line_1: While every sacred human interest pleads,
line_2: And urges the firm soul to lofty deeds.

line_1: And bid him hear when truth and nature pleads. "
line_2: My voice shall urge his soul to gen'rous deeds,

line_1: By mournful love, that eye of softness pleads?
line_2: When from thy frantic look our glance recedes?
And when her hapless husband bleeds,

line_1: Look forth, and be convinc'd! 'tis Nature pleads,
line_2: The simple-minded swain, who running reads,

line_1: Still for us his Death he pleads;

line_2: And av'rice being judge, with ease succeeds.

line_1: While strenuous, thus, Sir Thomas pleads,
line_2: Will smiles assent — the Knight proceeds.
